title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement rfordatasci@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to pkgflash
text: outlines propose change pkgflash.

title: Contributing to pkgflash
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to pkgflash
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to pkgflash
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("r4ds/pkgflash", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to pkgflash
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to pkgflash
text: Please note pkgflash project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

SOFTWARE PROVIDED “”, WITHOUT WARRANTY KIND, EXPRESS IMPLIED, INCLUDING LIMITED WARRANTIES MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS PARTICULAR PURPOSE NONINFRINGEMENT. EVENT SHALL AUTHORS COPYRIGHT HOLDERS LIABLE CLAIM, DAMAGES LIABILITY, WHETHER ACTION CONTRACT, TORT OTHERWISE, ARISING , CONNECTION SOFTWARE USE DEALINGS SOFTWARE.

title: Getting help with pkgflash
text: Thanks using pkgflash! filing issue, places explore pieces put together make process smooth possible.

title: Getting help with pkgflash
text: Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven’t heard used reprex , ’re treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (pretty insane ROI five ten minutes ’ll take learn ’s ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help! section tidyverse site.

title: Getting help with pkgflash
text: Armed reprex, next step figure ask. ’s question: start R4DS Online Learning Community Slack. people answer questions. might also try community.rstudio.com /StackOverflow. ’s bug: ’re right place, file issue. ’re sure: let community help figure ! problem bug feature request, can easily return report . opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

title: Getting help with pkgflash
text: Development packages tends bursty, shouldn’t worry don’t get immediate response. Typically don’t look repo sufficient quantity issues accumulates, ’s burst intense activity focus efforts. makes development efficient avoids expensive context switching problems, cost taking longer get back . process makes good reprex particularly important might multiple months initial report start working . can’t reproduce bug, can’t fix !

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jon Harmon. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Harmon J (2022). pkgflash: Flashcards Code Syntax. https://github.com/r4ds/pkgflash, https://r4ds.github.io/pkgflash/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {pkgflash: Flashcards for Code Syntax},   author = {Jon Harmon},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/r4ds/pkgflash, https://r4ds.github.io/pkgflash/}, }

title: Flashcards for Code Syntax
text: modern IDEs make easy look arguments functions, actually know function syntax, can read understand code quickly (see Programmer’s Brain Felienne Hermans information). {pkgflash} generates flashcards make easier learn syntax package’s exported functions.

title: Flashcards for Code Syntax
text: can install development version pkgflash GitHub :

title: Flashcards for Code Syntax
text: need look existing options flashcards continue. might result change first function returns, general idea ready. Let’s say ’m trying really wrap head around {rlang} package. One thing can help read {rlang}-using code learn functions arguments. can see 432 functions exported {rlang} (time README built). use rlang::ns_env() function package. Let’s look argument(s) (default values, ) begin internalize function works. sole argument rlang::ns_env() x, default value caller_env(). ’s another function {rlang}. rlang::caller_env() takes argument n, tells many callers go back (ie, far stack go). envision flashcards eventually showing function name, asking recall (eventually maybe type ) names arguments. perhaps ’ll allow “flip” card , recalling default values arguments. Long-term, like build concepts spaced repetition interleaving, allow use package learning tool.
code: library(pkgflash) rlang_fns <- pkg_fn_info("rlang") rlang_fns$ns_env #> $x #> caller_env() rlang_fns$caller_env #> $n #> [1] 1

title: Flashcards for Code Syntax
text: Please note pkgflash project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

text: trick sorting data functions. may easier way .

List functions exported by a package — .pkg_fns
text: pkg character naming installed package.

title: List functions exported by a package — .pkg_fns
text: list actual functions exported package (just names).

what: List exported functions and their arguments — pkg_fn_info
title: List exported functions and their arguments — pkg_fn_info
text: Generate list functions exported package, along arguments, default values arguments.

title: List exported functions and their arguments — pkg_fn_info
List exported functions and their arguments — pkg_fn_info
text: pkg character naming installed package.

title: List exported functions and their arguments — pkg_fn_info
text: named list named pairlists. names outer list functions, names contained pairlist arguments. values pairlists default values arguments.

title: List exported functions and their arguments — pkg_fn_info
text: Note: can get values "base" package, primitive functions show NULL arguments.

title: List exported functions and their arguments — pkg_fn_info
